name: Rep. Jim McGovern

tweet_text: To me—and I think to most people across America—that sentiment was repulsive and unacceptable. Love is love, hate has no place here, and no person should be denied equal rights because of who they are or who they want to spend their life with.

tweet_text:
Skimming occurs when criminals place a “skimming” device on an ATM or Point of Sale device to capture the PIN and data stored on the magnetic strip. 

Criminals then use that information to duplicate the card and access the benefits in the SNAP beneficiary’s account.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
I’m leading the call to restore SNAP benefits stolen through an illegal process known as skimming—and to prevent it from happening in the future.
https://t.co/pIOafNX2nM

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: As a member of the Agriculture Committee, but more importantly, as someone who cares about our planet and about making it easier to get healthy, nutritious, locally-grown food, this farm tour continues to inspire me.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
This year’s farm tour is in the books! Here’s some of what I learned:
 
➡️ I wouldn’t last a day on a farm.
 
➡️ Climate change is threatening how farmers farm.

➡️ Drought is affecting farming.
 
➡️ New farmers need access to land.

➡️ MA farmers understand land stewardship.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
We’re ending the day at the Jordan Dairy Farm in Rutland.
 
They were the first farm in the country to install an anaerobic digester—that’s a process of using organic matter to produce power. Pretty impressive! https://t.co/faCdZXpF1c

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
We just arrived at Clover Hill Farm in Gilbertville.
 
What’s unique about Clover Hill is that their pasture-raised livestock and non-GMO feed is all local, delivering fresh food to local residents and minimizing their environmental footprint. And they have a great farm store! https://t.co/XqbusBjsnb

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Now we’re in Barre at Carter and Stevens Farm. It’s a dairy farm that’s been in the family for five generations.
 
And they have a brewery! Great way to spend a day on the farm enjoying drinks and local food options. https://t.co/YsfLVrD9Je

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Next Stop: Free Living Farm in Petersham.
 
The farmers here are intentional about caring for the soil and ecology around the farm. They get that your health is impacted by what you eat. I couldn’t agree more. Food is medicine! https://t.co/BVd9mStkYj

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
🚗 🚗 🚗

Seeds of Solidarity proves that farms come in all shapes and sizes by growing healthy food in harmony with nature and training the next generation of farmers. https://t.co/QRIpzZoIwf

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: .@HouseDemocrats are laser-focused on lowering costs for American consumers, fighting inflation and corporate price gouging, and standing up for working families.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: H.R. 2543, the Federal Reserve Racial and Economic Equity Act, will help address racial and economic inequities that limit opportunities for Americans to buy homes, access loans, and earn fair wages.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: Who does corporate price gouging hurt most? Communities that experience oppression and marginalization. America’s racial wealth gap has been made worse by the COVID pandemic.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: By passing the Lower Food and Fuel Costs Act, House Democrats and the Biden Administration are fighting for working people and for the people who are being most directly impacted by rising costs.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: But their own internal earnings data contradict that claim. Their profit margins—the amount of money they are making over and above their costs—have skyrocketed since the pandemic.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: For example, four conglomerates control the market for meat & use their power to increase prices & underpay farmers. They claim meat processors are just passing along higher prices to consumers.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: And at the supermarket, costs are going up because of supply chain issues—but also because of corporate greed and price gouging that has got to stop.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: It’s wrong. And Putin’s war against Ukraine and OPEC’s price gouging are only making things worse. So we are passing another bill to help lower gas prices for consumers.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: As economic demand returns, Americans are using more gas. But instead of making more gas, Big Oil companies are deliberately making less gas so they can charge people more.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Forced arbitration is even becoming common in employment contracts, limiting workers’ access to justice.

Importantly, this bill does not ban arbitration, it simply gives consumers and workers the choice to arbitrate, rather than be forced into it.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
In fact, their only real incentive is to rule in favor of the company, so they get repeat business.

Does any of this sound fair? It shouldn’t.

Simply put, these forced arbitration clauses are a “get-out-of-jail-free” card for corporate America.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
The outcome is shielded from any scrutiny—without a judge, jury, or right to appeal.

These arbitrators don’t have to follow the law or the facts. They don’t even have to follow basic notions of fairness or justice.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Once you sign, you waive right to sue in a court of law, participate in a class action lawsuit, or appeal.
 
You agree that any dispute that arises as the result of buying a product or using a service must be settled by a company’s own hand-picked arbitrators.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
For decades, corporate America has used forced arbitration clauses in everything from cell phone plans to employment contracts.

Almost all of us have signed a forced arbitration clause that was tucked into the fine print or buried in the terms and conditions. https://t.co/Vs0u2H7uf9

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
At a time of unprecedented inequality and economic unfairness, BUILD BACK BETTER turns the page on four decades of failed trickle-down economics.

It invests in the backbone of our country: in our workers, in our middle class, and in everyone fighting hard to get there.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
I have talked to so many of you who are sick and tired of working hard but falling behind.

All you want is a country and a Congress that looks out for your interests and puts your needs first. That is what BUILD BACK BETTER ACT does.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
That work is bigger than a single president or plan.

Because today, all these years later, President Biden and Democrats are working to fulfill the promise of making life better for the American people by passing the BUILD BACK BETTER ACT.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
11/ I will return to Washington to share with Speaker Pelosi and President Biden what I saw on the ground.

My hope is that my fact-finding mission will help open the way for a deeper and more thoughtful debate and discussion in congress about our policies toward Colombia.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
10/ There is also great reason for hope in the courage and work of mayors, organized communities, demobilized combatants, youth, religious & other leaders committed to creating opportunity & building peace.

They need to be supported.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: 9/ A large & growing number of my colleagues in congress, as well as our constituents, are unwilling to tolerate U.S. foreign assistance being used to violate the #HumanRights of protesters or murder social leaders & human rights defenders—in Colombia or anywhere else.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: 8/ And I’m deeply concerned about the incomplete implementation of the 2016 peace accords, which provide the road map for addressing long-standing structural problems in Colombia.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: 7/ I treasure the friendship between the United States and Colombia. I want our countries to be close. But I’m very disappointed by setbacks on issues that matter to the U.S. Congress. I’m deeply concerned about the human rights situation in Colombia.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
6/ What we heard has caused me deep concern.

I was especially concerned by the frustration and fears we heard from organizations that have been fighting for peace for a long time, but today feel that things are going in a wrong and very dangerous direction.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: 5/ We met with President Duque and encouraged him to engage in dialogue with civil society and work with the United States to fully implement the 2016 peace accords. Dialogue is a sign of strength, not weakness.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: 4/ Over the past week, we heard from government officials; Afro-Colombian, indigenous, campesino & LGBTQ leaders; threatened journalists; victims of police violence & their grieving families; multilateral bodies that monitor human rights & the peace accords; & faith leaders. https://t.co/kA8IXuRt83

name: Rep. Jim McGovern

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Build Back Better is not the Democratic agenda or the Republican agenda. It is the American agenda.

It's about delivering real results to people in this country who've been left out or left behind for far too long.

We must get this done #ForThePeople🇺🇸

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Feel the system is rigged against working people and middle-class families like yours?

It is. Build Back Better cuts taxes for families with children, increases the Earned Income Tax Credit, and pays for it by asking big corporations and the ultra rich to pay their fair share.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Worried about the future of the planet? 

Me too. Build Back Better creates a brand new Civilian Climate Corps, expands and extends clean energy and electric vehicle tax credits, and more.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Concerned about the price of college?

Build Back Better would provide all students with two years of free community college—boosting the earnings of low-wage high school graduates by nearly $6,000 per year.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Don't have dental or vision insurance?

Build Back Better expands Medicare to include dental, vision, and hearing coverage so seniors are not left out in the cold when it comes to glasses, hearing aids, or dentures.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Having trouble affording your prescription drugs?

Build Back Better would lower the price of your medication, meaning no more painful bills at the pharmacy or delaying important treatments until you can afford them.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Struggling with the high cost of child care? You're not alone.

Build Back Better invests in high-quality child care, making it cheaper to get your kids into a great child care or preschool program so you can get back to work and have peace of mind that they're safe and thriving.

Let us reflect on how well America has responded to that challenge.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
5/ I still believe the most enduring legacy of 9/11 isn't in our anger or sorrow, but in the love & kindness exhibited by our fellow Americans.

Scripture says that in our suffering is glory, because “suffering produces perseverance—perseverance, character—and character, hope.”

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
4/ Tara Creamer; Lynn Goodchild; Christopher Zarba, Jr.; Linda George; Robin Kaplan; and Dianne Snyder.

The first Sunday after the attacks, at an ecumenical church service in Worcester, I said “our faith teaches us that love is stronger than hate.”

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
3/ Twenty Septembers have come and gone. And though the passage of time can dull, it can never diminish the heartbreak and loss seared onto the conscience of our country that morning. 

It can never bring back the beautiful lives from our district that we lost:

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: 2/ Our concern turning into fear as we ran from the Capitol Building—a target spared by the heroic patriotism and selfless sacrifice of the passengers on Flight 93. I tried to get through to my wife to tell her to get our son out of day care, but the phone lines were jammed.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: My full remarks in support of establishing a Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol. https://t.co/UNVXTkgrrC

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
For Congress to do nothing in response to a literal insurrection would allow our democracy to be destroyed from within.

Not on my watch.

Our system of government is fragile. It is not a given, it is a choice.

I will proudly vote yes on this resolution.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
I’m tired of the indifference.

And I’m disgusted by the fact that there are too many Republican members of congress who continue to put party over country and propagate The Big Lie, and the distortion, and the conspiracy theories that led to January 6th.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
A bipartisan commission emerged out of the Homeland Security Committee with a bipartisan vote. 

Everything the Minority Leader asked for in the Commission? He got it!

But then Donald Trump called him, and he began walking back his support.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
History will judge how we respond to the events of January 6th.

And the glare of history should be cast most harshly on @GOPLeader McCarthy, who worked overtime to prevent a bipartisan, bicameral commission from being formed to examine what happened on January 6th.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
When you put your name on the ballot, you sign up to take all kinds of incoming.

But the staff here…the cafeteria workers, the cleaning crews, the people who make our democracy function day in and day out. They don't.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
They weren’t here to peacefully protest. They were fueled by rage & here to cause harm. I looked in their eyes & saw hate.

Many of my colleagues feared for their lives. Some called loved ones to say goodbye. The staff that work here barricaded office doors & hid in closets.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
I was one of the last people off the House Floor as we were being taken to a secure location away from the mayhem.

As I was walking out, I looked over and saw people literally smashing the doors with their bare fists and breaking the glass to try to get to us.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
THREAD: 175 days ago, the United States Capitol became a crime scene when homegrown terrorists resorted to violence in an attempt to prevent the certification of a free and fair election.

I will never forget that day. https://t.co/FRgbSqXdDf

name: Rep. Jim McGovern

I learned that communities often couldn't afford the best equipment to keep firefighters and other first responders safe, so I worked with my colleagues to find a solution.

Over the past 20 years, our program has provided more than 79,000 awards totaling more than $12 billion.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
In December of 1999, a cold storage warehouse fire devastated our community when it claimed the lives of six firefighters in Worcester, Massachusetts.

In the aftermath of this terrible tragedy, I and others investigated what could be done to better equip America's firefighters.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
I believe it is time for a course correction on U.S. policy toward Venezuela. It is time to stop using the well-being of the Venezuelan people as a bargaining chip.

The Biden administration must find other ways to pursue its foreign policy goals.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
While U.S. officials debate the sanctions policy in Washington, for people in Venezuela the ongoing crisis is a life-and-death matter.

Sanctions should never be used to punish whole populations for the actions of their leaders or to bludgeon an adversary into submission.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
Unlike smart sanctions that target the behavior of specific individuals, the impact of sectoral and secondary sanctions is indiscriminate, and purposely so.

The percentage of Venezuelans living in poverty increased from 48% in 2014 to 96% in 2019, with 80% in extreme poverty.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text: I am asking the Biden administration to lift all secondary and sectoral sanctions imposed on #Venezuela by the Trump Administration. https://t.co/6VDMir337L

5/ I don’t want to manage hunger or make it better. 
But truly end food insecurity in this country once and for all. And do it by 2030, as the UN has called for.  

The challenge before us is great. But I believe this goal is in our grasp if we’re willing to fight for it.

name: Rep. Jim McGovern
tweet_text:
4/ For too long, we have lacked only one thing: the political will. 
 
Today, we begin to change that. And we start building what I hope will become a roadmap to end hunger in America. 

Not tinker around the edges. Not get us to where we were before the COVID pandemic hit.
